title: Martin Kaymer moves into share of lead at Italian Open
short_headline: Martin Kaymer moves into share of lead at Italian Open
page_title: Martin Kaymer moves into share of lead at Italian Open
headline: Martin Kaymer moves into share of lead at Italian Open
body:
MONZA, Italy (AP) Martin Kaymer opened with four straight birdies on his way to a 7-under 65 Saturday to grab a share of the lead after the third round of the Italian Open.

The former top-ranked German had his lone bogey on the fifth but added another four birdies to sit tied with Jens Fahrbring of Sweden and Frenchman Romain Wattel atop the leaderboard with a 17-under total of 199.

Fahrbring, who led overnight with Lucas Bjerregaard of Denmark, had seven birdies but dropped three shots on his way to a 68. Wattel carded a 66.

The trio is two shots ahead of Fabrizio Zanotti of Paraguay (68), Bjerregaard (70) and Austrian Bernd Wiesberger (67).
